Message.Msg: yhoo's earnings are increasing I'll take increased earnings over increased revenue things are changing and revenues will follow Keep increasing earnings!

Message.Title: Yahoo to file bankruptcy on the open!
Message.Msg: Second-quarter revenue, excluding money passed to partner sites, will be as much as $1.09 billion, Sunnyvale, California, based Yahoo said yesterday on its website. Analysts on average had projected revenue of $1.11 billion, according to data compiled by Bloomberg. First quarter net income attributable to Yahoo increased 36 percent to $390.3 million, or 35 cents a share, from $286.3 million, or 23 cents, a year earlier, the company said in a statement. Profit excluding 3 cents related to stock-based compensation was 38 cents a share, compared with 27 cents a year earlier, Yahoo said. The company began excluding stock-based compensation from earnings per share in the first quarter. Analysts had estimated 25 cents, on average, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.

Yahoo isn't developing tech breaktroughs, it's delivering content which advertisers pay to ride along with. Just 'cuz the medium is the web and mobile doesn't alter the fundamental elements...it sells ads. Less interest in the content, fewer viewers, less ad dollars.

Message.Title: Yahoo raised to buy on Asian assets potential by BofA
Message.Msg: Yahoo Inc. on Wednesday was upgraded to buy from neutral by Bank of America Merrill Lynch a day after the Web portal reported disappointing results that sent its stock falling. BofA analyst Justin Post said Yahoo's core business was still weak, but the company's Asian assets, particularly its stake in Alibaba, are "hard to ignore." "Alibaba's potential valuation is fundamental to Yahoo's stock price," he argued. Yahoo shares were up in early trades.

Message.Title: 4/17/13 AM... Bank of America UPGRADES Yahoo! to Buy on Weaker Revenue Trends, Good Asset Value... $28 TARGET!!!
Message.Msg: In a report published Wednesday, Bank of America analyst Justin Post upgraded the rating on Yahoo! (NASDAQ: YHOO [FREE Stock Trend Analysis]) from Neutral to Buy, and raised the price target from $25.00 to $28.00. In the report, Post noted, “Yahoo reported weaker revenue trends with ex-TAC revenues at $1.08bn below our $1.11bn (down 3% y/y excluding TIPLA fees), and the stock was down 4% to $22.80 in the aftermarket. However EPS at $0.38 beat street at $0.25 due equity interest income and using Yahoo's 1Q results, and Y! Japan 4Q results, we estimate that Alibaba profit was between $350-500mn in 4Q (up a strong 40-100% depending on impact of other undisclosed items). We think stock focus will quickly shift back to asset value and look forward to Yahoo's 10-Q filing (expected in May) where we will have better clarity on Alibaba's 4Q actual results.”

Message.Title: Yahoo Remains a Strong Buy Post Q1
Message.Msg: Yahoo reported first-quarter non-GAAP earnings that were up 11.6% sequentially and up 48.7% year-over-year, exceeding the Zacks Consensus Estimate by 10 cents, or 40.0%. The surprise history is also positive (35.1% in the four preceding quarters). Yahoo has a solid balance sheet, with cash and short term investments of $3.0 billion, which was however down $1.2 billion during the quarter. The company generated $297 million from operations in the last quarter and spent $109.8 million on capex and $70.5 million on share repurchases in the last quarter. Yahoo does not have any debt. Yahoo’s search business continues to show signs of improvement, despite softer pricing. Improvements on the display side are ongoing, although the impact is not apparent just yet. While the guidance was disappointing, ad improvements, technology enhancements and cost control are positives. Yahoo’s guidance indicates a 7.4% increase in operating income on a revenue decline of 5.7%, which is indicative of solid cost control. Yahoo shares have appreciated 47.9% over the last six months, after the Alibaba issue was resolved, the company started retreating from unprofitable markets and acquiring companies to build its position in mobile. Yahoo shares currently have a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).

Message.Title: Apple to buy Yahoo and Twitter or continue to die
Message.Msg: Apple has the cash to buy both Twitter and Yahoo! and that would totally change the landscape for mobile phone competition. If I was Tim Cook, I'd put Marissa Mayer in charge to run it and try and ensure that the cultures of Twitter and Yahoo! was left alone from the rest of Apple. They are very different cultures. Eric Jackson-

Message.Title: I predict YHOO will close higher today.
Message.Msg: I'd say $24.5

Message.Title: Invest in Yahoo for Its Asian Assets
Message.Msg: The focus for Yahoo investors shouldn't be CEO Marissa Mayer's turnaround efforts, but the value of its Asian assets, say analysts. "Those Asian assets are on fire from our perspective," DiClemente said. Yahoo owns 24 percent of China e-commerce firm Alibaba Group and 35 percent of Yahoo Japan." Kessler agrees. "If you look at the investments in Yahoo Japan and Alibaba Group, as well the significant cash and investments what you have is arguably value that constitutes more than half Yahoo's market capitalization," the S&P Capital IQ analyst said. "That we think is really going to be the driver for potential realized value in the quarters to come." Eric Jackson says most people who are investors in Yahoo! look at the investments in Alibaba and Yahoo! Japan first and foremost. I think Alibaba IPOs in the second half of this year for over $80 billion. The stake in Yahoo! Japan is worth $10 billion now (pre-tax), double what it was back in December. That means, on an after-tax basis, you're getting the Alibaba and Yahoo! Japan investments, plus Yahoo!'s cash (over $5 billion) for $25 billion out of the total market cap of $26.5 billion.

Message.Title: The dropping of Yahoo core.
Message.Msg: The dropping of Yahoo core is accelerating. The only thing holding Yahoo now is Alibaba and Yahoo Japan. Mobile won't bring much revenue in a few years plus Yahoo has no core on mobile. After Alibaba IPO there will not be much left for Yahoo. MSFT is killing Yahoo with its search deal. I don't believe the display ad will grow in the second half of 2013. That's just the way the management is trying to gain more time for turn around. Institutions are trying to keep the stock price stable for a few days but soon the dropping will come.

Message.Title: "An Open Letter To the Marissa Mayer Haters"
Message.Msg: Well somebody is on fire today. Good to see a well written defense of Mayer - especially after the #$%$ that was written yesterday on this board. An excerpt from Forbes: "As sure as night follows day, the media and pundits love to build people up and then knock them down — and then build them back up again. Maybe it’s human nature. Maybe it’s part of being American. We love stars. We love gossip. And we love comeback stories. Nine months ago, the business media swooned at the hiring of Marissa Mayer as Yahoo YHOO -0.32%‘s (YHOO) next CEO. And for the next 8 months, the positive coverage continued. I’ve noticed this has taken a considerable turn in recent weeks."
